snippet.title: A wanted man turned himself into police after they shared an 'unflattering' mugshot
snippet.content:
Criminal accused of being ridiculously good looking 0:50
His really, really, ridiculously good-looking mugshot was posted on the Stockton Police Department Facebook page and has proved incredibly popular with the ladies. So who is this guy?
June 20th 2014 3 years ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Entertainment - syndicated/
Wayne Esmonde turned himself into police after they shared an 'unflattering' mugshot. Image: South Wales Police Swansea and Neath Port Talbot
Share
A MAN wanted over an alleged assault deemed his mugshot so unflattering that he turned himself into police. Wayne Esmonde, 35, was wanted by South Wales Police in connection with an assault on July 18 in Fforestfach, Swansea. A picture of him with a shaven head and wide eyes was posted by South Wales Police on their Facebook page. Mr Esmonde, who spotted his mugshot on social media, asked officers to take the post down before handing himself in at Swansea Central police station.
Wayne Esmonde was not pleased with his wide-eyed mugshot. Image: South Wales Police Swansea and Neath Port TalbotSource:Supplied He commented on his mugshot, saying that it was "not very flattering". "I am him. Not a very flattering mugshot," he wrote, according to the BBC. "I'd appreciate it if you'd take this post down. Innocent until proven guilty and all that. "I've spoken to my solicitor and they will advise me what to do next. Thanks."
